name: Ogyrvran

attributes.attribute: source of inspiration for sprites or Fairies

sources: Spence, Lewis. The Minor Traditions of British Mythology. (New York: Benjamin Blom, Inc., 1972), 82.
Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Welsh folklore and literature recount the tale of Ogyrvran, a heroic figure known to possess a Cauldron from which inspiration manifested in the form of sprites or fairies. His name appears to be linked to Ogmios, the Celtic deity of eloquence, indicating that he may be a remnant of local folklore related to this god.
